summary: An email from an Assistant United States Attorney in the Southern District of New York to John Diaz, regarding a trial subpoena for a witness. The email discusses witness preparation and the scheduling of testimony for a trial beginning November 29, 2021.

persons.name: John Diaz
persons.role: Recipient of email regarding witness subpoena
persons.context: Addressed in an email from an AUSA regarding a trial subpoena for a witness. Likely a legal professional or contact for the witness.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.context: Author of the email, informing John Diaz about a subpoena for a witness to testify in a trial starting November 29, 2021, and discussing preparation and logistics.

connections.description: The AUSA is communicating with John Diaz regarding legal logistics for a witness in an upcoming trial.

events.title: Trial scheduled to begin
events.description: A trial is scheduled to begin on this date. A witness is being subpoenaed to testify, likely in the second or third week of December 2021.

locations: St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: A trial related to the Epstein case was scheduled to begin on November 29, 2021.
Prosecutors planned to call a witness who had undergone multiple preparatory sessions.
The witness was expected to testify in December 2021, during the second or third week of the trial.
The communication originated from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York.
The document indicates active trial preparation and witness coordination was ongoing in mid-2021.
